Guardians of the Deep
OUR MISSION
Discovering and sharing the secrets of our natural world through exploration, observation and research. Inspiring conservation through awareness and education to build a future of mutualistic co-existence. The ocean is the earth’s lifeblood; without healthy marine ecosystems, life on earth would cease to exist. Our everyday choices empower us to become the change that is required to respect the delicate natural balance and to acknowledge the importance of a healthy environment.

imagining | balancing | transforming
Sally Sivewright - Marine Biologist

Sally is a BSc graduate, with a double major in Zoology and Botany, from the Nelson Mandela University in the Eastern Cape Province of South Africa. Sally spent a year in Scotland studying Marine Science at the Scottish Association for Marine Science and three years working through the Game Ranging and Wildlife Management course while volunteering at a local private game reserve.

Sally’s key focus is on conservation biology, animal behaviour and rehabilitation while her other interests include photography, adventures and dog sledding. The rugged wilderness of South Africa and more specifically the ocean off Kommetjie, a small village on the west coast of the Cape Peninsula; provided a rich backdrop growing up and allowed Sally to nurture her love for animals and the environment as a whole.

“Conservation” and a “sustainable future” are more than just buzz words to Sally and as such she hopes to make an impact on how people perceive science and the environment.

Website: Scientist In Limbo
Dr Alejandra Vargas-Fonseca(DVM, Msc)

Sally is a BSc graduate, with a double major in Zoology and Botany, from the Nelson Mandela University in the Eastern Cape Province of South Africa. She also spent a year in Scotland studying Marine Science at the Scottish Association for Marine Science and three years working through the Game Ranging and Wildlife Management course while volunteering at a local private game reserve.

Sally’s key focus is on conservation biology, animal behaviour and rehabilitation while her other interests include photography, adventures and dog sledding. The rugged wilderness of South Africa and more specifically the ocean off Kommetjie, a small village on the west coast of the Cape Peninsula; provided a rich backdrop growing up and allowed Sally to nurture her love for animals and the environment as a whole.

“Conservation” and a “sustainable future” are more than just buzz words to Sally and as such she hopes to make an impact on how people perceive science and the environment.

WebSite: Scientist In Limbo
Mohini

Sees the beauty and love all around her and has broad life experience. From work with Jacques Cousteau to time spent with Tibetan monks. Mohini has unique insights into the mind and body and how nature plays a vital role in our well-being and peace of Mind. She has traveled to many places and understands the studies and practices that help us look after our minds and bodies. Mohini holds an International cerificate in Water Yoga, has studied acupuncture and works through the Science of the Soul. Mohini is active in various local and international social welfare programs and human skills development.

WebSite: Scientist In Limbo
Ronel

Artist, art therapist, set builder, land artist, and gallery and creative curator for numerous exhibitions, creative projects and international art representations. Constantly endeavours to create through imagination the wonder and beauty of artworks in all forms that pay homage to the creative muses, inspiring and connecting individuals, groups and communities to their own innate creativity.

WebSite: Scientist In Limbo
Sheila

Sheila has many years experience as a Broadcast and Corporate video editor and has been active in the communications industry from the inception of commercial television in South Africa to Senior Editor and Partner at SP Studios.

Sheila studied Radio, Communications and Creative Writing in Chicago, Illinois before joining Van Zyl and Schultz Advertising to set up a Broadcast television studio with her mentor Andy Stead. Together they moved to ZSE TV, now Sasani, becoming part of a marvelous, growing, vibrant Facility house. It was here that she formed lifelong friendships, a network stretching across the globe.

High points of this period were initiating filter coffee machines en suite, powdering Raymond Ackerman's forehead for the PnP Chairman's Letter shoot and a single Loerie Award for the NBS Bank 'Yes, yes, yes' Cockatoo!

Sheila plays a key role in interpreting, visualising and assembling the scripted elements of media communication.

WebSite: SP Studios
Paul

Began a career in sound engineering working for Rhodesia Television and the Department of Education. Moved to Johannesburg in 1965 and was active in recording many of the programmes that made Springbok radio such a popular station in those days before television. Paul produced and presented "Sterns Hitmakers" during that time and recorded a "7 single" with the now famous South Africa producer, John "Mutt" Lange.

Moving to Gallo Studios and music engineering provided the opportunity to record with Mimi Coertse, Joan and Louis Berk Theatre productions, The Bats and Billy Forrest to name a few. Paul joined J.Walter Thompson advertising agency to run their multimedia facilities and worked with Barry Goldman on some ground breaking multi-screen productions for Siemens amongst others.

Sheila McCallister and Paul formed SP Studios in 1991, initially operating from the basement of Sandton City and later moving to our own studios in Hurlingham Office Park. We spent 15 happy years there providing video, audio and graphics production and post-production services to advertising agencies and clients such as Porsche, IDC, SA Breweries, Red Cross, Unicef and Sappi. We found most reward in creating educational and informative videos that impart knowledge and training to the audience.

WebSite: SP Studios
